description: Each player can be a member of up to one 'city'
A player can found a city by placing a shrine
The player who starts a city is labelled 'king'
A king can invite new members to a city
Destroying a city shrine destroys the city
A player can leave a city
If a city owns an object, all members can use it
A player can cede an object to his city
A king can grant a city object to a player
A player can declare war on another player
Players can agree to return to peace
Two players at war with each other can fight
Players at war can destroy the other's objects
A player at war with a city can seek peace from its king
Two kings can agree to return to peace
Each player can build one 'shrine'-class object
Shrine actions require an animal carcass
Items have durability, affected by combat and use.
Objects can be repaired with materials
Items can be repaired with materials
There can be groups of two or more players
A player's group shows up on the UI
Grouped players can invite others to their group
Non-grouped players can invite others to form a group
The first player to damage an NPC tags it, until it dies or disengages.
A player can be in an alternate 'instance'
Instances get static objects from templates
A player can create and enter a new instance
Instance entrance happens at a specific point in the world
Grouped players can enter the same instance
Instances are destroyed after being empty for (30m?)
There's a way to leave instances, to a specific point in the world
NPCs can specify a set of items for their image
NPCs can specify a custom human template image
A pyramid object that is unique
Players and cities can be at war with each other
Heavy items that prevent player movement
Containers may allow 'heavy' objects or not
Some tool objects have a cooldown
Make players and objects more visible on map
Sort _materials and _craftableItems by name, not ID
When a player joins a city, that city adopts his wars
Make it more obvious when something is out of range

Prevent chat messages being cut off
Allow a recipe to create multiple item types
Stacks of the same item can be combined

An altar that grants a buff
